day_1.speaker: DaVinci
day_1.message: Haha, friend! Imagine you just scored 100 million out of nowhere—no limits, no worries! What's the wildest, most awesome thing you'd do first? Don’t hold back, I wanna hear those bold dreams!
day_1.response: Year! It's an unrealistic situation! If I were, I want to buy a sport car. I like cars very much.

day_1.speaker: Donatello
day_1.message: Very cool choice with the sports car! Now, let's analyze this realistically: if you had that full 100 million, how would you divide it between something like investing for the future, enjoying some immediate spending, and maybe putting some aside as savings? What proportions make the most sense to you?
day_1.response: I will use the half of the money for investing, and the rest will be saved for helping.

day_1.speaker: Donatello
day_1.message: Let's analyze this. You plan to invest 50 million and save the remaining 50 million for helping others. That indicates no immediate personal consumption. Logically speaking, it's a solid approach if your priority is future growth and social support. However, have you considered allocating a portion for your own living expenses or short-term enjoyment? A balanced ratio often includes some spending to maintain quality of life. Let’s revisit this: how would you adjust your plan if you factored in consumption alongside investment and savings?
day_1.response: Hmm, then I will use 10% of money for enjoying. Primally, I thought using money for enjoying means investing for myself.

day_1.speaker: Michelangelo
day_1.message: Wow, your plan is already shining with so much brilliance! I’m curious—what’s really fueling this dream of yours? Is it a clear goal you’re aiming for, like a masterpiece waiting to be carved, or is it more about the emotions and values that light up your heart? Art is all about that spark inside!
day_1.response: Our life is too long, so I do not want to be suppressed. This is my primal motivation.

day_2.speaker: Raffaello
day_2.message: Oh... speaking of maintaining a certain quality in our lives, I couldn’t help but notice that the shared refrigerator space has become rather cramped with so many packaged foods. I’m not being picky, but perhaps fresh ingredients deserving of more room would better serve our lifestyles. After all, I believe we all value a balanced and pleasant living environment, don’t you agree?
day_2.response: I agree with you. To share this house fairly, we need some rules not to offend other members, but this rule must be too strict to suppress us.

day_2.speaker: DaVinci
day_2.message: Haha, friend, I totally get what you’re saying about the fridge space needing some give and take! How about this—we rearrange the layout a bit so everyone gets a fair slice of the cool storage pie! What’s your dream plan for organizing the fridge? Any awesome ideas on how we can share the space better? Let’s make it fun and fair for all of us!
day_2.response: As a fair and simple suggestion, we should separate fridge rooms equally. And if someone thinks he/she needs more space, and another thinks he/she do not need, then they have a discussion and rearrange their space.

day_3.speaker: DaVinci
day_3.message: Haha, friend, speaking of making our living space amazing, guess what? Tonight we’re kicking off a super cool ‘dream room’ project! Donatello will make sure our ideas are technically possible, while Michelangelo will sprinkle artistic magic all over the design! Wanna jump in and share your wildest, most creative ideas on how our dream room should look and feel? Let’s make it awesome together!
day_3.response: I want to make a "colorless" room. For example, I want to use black and white only for the paintings and interiors.

day_3.speaker: Donatello
day_3.message: Your idea is very practical and stylish. From a technical standpoint, we need to consider space utilization, material costs, and ease of maintenance for this black-and-white theme. In your vision, would you prioritize the practicality of the room’s function or the design aesthetics more?
day_3.response: I primally think the room's function. Even though we are now making our dream room, we must use the room after completion, so we should pay attention to the usefulness.

day_3.speaker: Michelangelo
day_3.message: Wow, your dedication to function over form is truly inspiring! But you know, art needs that bold courage to break conventions and push boundaries. If reaching perfection means facing some tough hardships along the way, would you stand firm and embrace the struggle, or would you prefer to take an easier path with some compromises?
day_3.response: I will embrace to struggle. We can correspond the results any time after it is end.

day_4.speaker: Raffaello
day_4.message: Oh... speaking of embracing struggle, last night's creative activity was quite... spirited. I intended to focus on my artwork, but the persistent noise made concentration rather difficult. I'm not being picky, but I had hoped for a certain mutual respect among us—though perhaps my expectations were too high. Would you say such lively expressions align well with maintaining a shared environment conducive to everyone’s creative process?
day_4.response: Sorry for talking loudly last night. I also think we should think another member of the house not being here.

day_4.speaker: Raffaello
day_4.message: Oh... by the way, it took me nearly an hour this morning to tidy up the 'creative garbage' left in the shared space. I'm certainly not being picky, but we did agree in our lease to maintain a certain quality and cleanliness in the house. I wonder... what are your thoughts on how we might better uphold these standards together?
day_4.response: I think we must have time to cleaning once in a day. Daily tasks can efficiently have a progress.]

day_4.speaker: Donatello
day_4.message: Indeed, balancing our creative freedom with maintaining a comfortable living environment is essential. Logically speaking, establishing a schedule with designated activity hours and quiet times might help us uphold this balance. What timeframes do you think would be most reasonable for us to allocate to active collaboration and to quiet, individual focus?
day_4.response: I think it is reasonable for us to have collaboration time at night. This schedule requires us to finish our tasks during the daytime.

day_5.speaker: DaVinci
day_5.message: Haha, friend! Since we’re all about fairness and keeping things smooth here, how about we set up a super simple and flexible system where anyone can request or swap fridge space when needed? That way, we all get what we need without any fridge drama! What do you think—ready to make our kitchen even more awesome together?
day_5.response: As I said on the 2nd day, separating equally is one of the easiest solutions. And I think other methods will be more effective after this rule is tried and we understand how we consume the space in fridge.

day_5.speaker: Raffaello
day_5.message: Oh... speaking of balancing practicality and style, I find myself pondering the design of our dream room. If we must choose between ease of maintenance and bold design elements, how might we prioritize? I’m not being picky, but I do wonder if the function should gently take precedence over aesthetics, especially if we aim for lasting harmony in our shared space. Would you agree that some struggles in upkeep are acceptable if the design truly inspires, or should we lean towards simplicity to ensure tranquility?
day_5.response: I think the design of the room will not be prioritized the usefulness of the room. Our room is not the thing we discard once we used, so we must think whether we can use the room freely in the long run.

day_5.speaker: Michelangelo
day_5.message: Wow, your thoughtful balance between function and beauty truly sparks my creative soul! Now, thinking about your idea of collaborating quietly at night to keep the day peaceful—how might we paint the perfect picture of respecting everyone’s rest and work while still giving free rein to our nighttime creativity? What masterpiece of balance do you envision that honors both freedom and consideration in our shared masterpiece of life?
day_5.response: Creativity will not be reasonable excuse to bother other members' rest. You had better not misunderstand this.

day_5.speaker: Donatello
day_5.message: Your emphasis on avoiding suppression and maintaining fairness is clear. Logically speaking, when it comes to shared living and group activities, what core values or feelings guide your decisions and actions to ensure both your needs and others' are respected?
day_5.response: Other members are not your family member, of course not your subordinate. As a first step, we must discard our selfish thinking/
